meanings.definition: To beat or strike with a hard blow.
meanings.sent1: He will swinge the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would swinge the hot metal to shape it.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to swinge the dough to make it softer.
meanings.sent4: The waves swinge against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's punch swinge his opponent to the ground.

meanings.sent1: The wind will swinge the door shut.
meanings.sent2: The athlete can swinge through the obstacles with ease.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to swinge across the tree branches playfully.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements swinge gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The car will swinge around the corner at high speed.

meanings.sent1: The knight delivered a powerful swinge to his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch broke with a loud swinge.
meanings.sent3: The comedian exaggerated the swinge in his joke for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The storm brought a fierce swinge of wind and rain.
meanings.sent5: The final swinge of the hammer completed the sculpture.
